Screen.title: TopScreen
Screen.Label: ---------- Mouse Button 1 click on field to change ----------

Help.Tip: Menu allowing user choice of stored parameter defaults.
Help.Text:
tslice - PROCESSDEFAULTS
Menu allowing user choice of stored parameter defaults.
 
 Default = SYSTEM
 Allowed = SYSTEM
 Allowed = PROJECT
 Allowed = USER
 SYSTEM defaults are the defaults listed in the CPS documentation.
 
 PROJECT defaults are defaults the user has saved via the Save as Project
 Default button.
 
 USER defaults are defaults the user has saved via the Save as User Default
 button.

Screen.title: TSLICE
Screen.Label: TSLICE - Time SLICE output.
Output slices to the trace flow and / or disk
OPTION =
PATH_NAME=
SLOW_HDR =
FAST_HDR =
SLOW_TOT =
FAST_TOT =
SLICE_TOT =
SLOW_MIN =
FAST_MIN =
SLICE_MIN =
SLOW_MAX =
FAST_MAX =
SLICE_MAX =
SLOW_INC =
FAST_INC =
SLICE_INC =
FAST_SCALE=

Help.Tip: Output option.
Help.Text:
tslice - OPTION
Output option.
 
 Default = EXTRENAL
 Allowed = EXTRENAL output slice traces extrnally after tslice.
 Allowed = INTRENAL output slice traces intrnally to a file.
 Allowed = BOTH  output both after tslice and to file.

Help.Tip: Output file name.
Help.Text:
tslice - PATH_NAME
Output file name.
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = Character.

Help.Tip: Header word for the direction across output traces direction.
Help.Text:
tslice - SLOW_HDR
Header word for the direction across output traces direction.
 
 Default = 7
 Allowed = 1 - NWIH

Help.Tip: Header word for along the output traces direction.
Help.Text:
tslice - FAST_HDR
Header word for along the output traces direction.
 
 Default = 7
 Allowed = 1 - NWIH

Help.Tip: Number of output bins in the across trace direction.
Help.Text:
tslice - SLOW_TOT
Number of output bins in the across trace direction.
 
 Default = 1
 Allowed = int>0

Help.Tip: Number of output bins in the along trace direction.
Help.Text:
tslice - FAST_TOT
Number of output bins in the along trace direction.
 
 Default = 1
 Allowed = int>0

Help.Tip: Number of output time slices.
Help.Text:
tslice - SLICE_TOT
Number of output time slices.
 
 Default = 1
 Allowed = int>0

Help.Tip: Minimum output value for the across trace direction.
Help.Text:
tslice - SLOW_MIN
Minimum output value for the across trace direction.
 
 Default = 0.0
 Allowed = real scalar

Help.Tip: Minimum output value for the along trace direction.
Help.Text:
tslice - FAST_MIN
Minimum output value for the along trace direction.
 
 Default = 0.0
 Allowed = real scalar

Help.Tip: Minimum output time slice value.
Help.Text:
tslice - SLICE_MIN
Minimum output time slice value.
 
 Default = 0.0
 Allowed = real scalar

Help.Tip: Maximum output value for the across trace direction.
Help.Text:
tslice - SLOW_MAX
Maximum output value for the across trace direction.
 
 Default = 0.0
 Allowed = real scalar

Help.Tip: Maximum output value for the along trace direction.
Help.Text:
tslice - FAST_MAX
Maximum output value for the along trace direction.
 
 Default = 0.0
 Allowed = real scalar

Help.Tip: Maximum output time slice value.
Help.Text:
tslice - SLICE_MAX
Maximum output time slice value.
 
 Default = 0.0
 Allowed = real scalar

Help.Tip: Output bin increment in the across trace direction.
Help.Text:
tslice - SLOW_INC
Output bin increment in the across trace direction.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real scalar

Help.Tip: Output bin increment in the along trace direction.
Help.Text:
tslice - FAST_INC
Output bin increment in the along trace direction.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real scalar

Help.Tip: Output time slice increment.
Help.Text:
tslice - SLICE_INC
Output time slice increment.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real scalar

Help.Tip: Output time origin and sample rate scale factor.
Help.Text:
tslice - FAST_SCALE
Output time origin and sample rate scale factor.
 
 Default = 100
 Allowed = real>0
 The output trace time sample rate will be set to FAST_INC / FAST_SCALE
 The output trace time origin      will be set to FAST_MIN / FAST_SCALE

Help.Tip: Header word slice array.
Help.Text:
tslice - SLICE_HEADER
Header word slice array.
 
 Default = none
 Allowed = 1 - NWIH

Help.Tip: Button that removes this process parameter screen.
Help.Text:
tslice - CLOSE
Button that removes this process parameter screen.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Appears only on the view-only process parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button to accept parameter values, run traps and remove screen.
Help.Text:
tslice - OK
Button to accept parameter values, run traps and remove screen.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that accepts parameter values, runs the parameter traps and removes
 the parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps.
Help.Text:
tslice - APPLY
Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps but does
 not remove the parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button to remove the parameter screen without changing parameters.
Help.Text:
tslice - CANCEL
Button to remove the parameter screen without changing parameters.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =

Help.Tip: Set parameters to their initial value or last applied value.
Help.Text:
tslice - RESET
Set parameters to their initial value or last applied value.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that sets the parameters back to their values when the screen appeared
 or to their last applied value.

Help.Tip: Accept the current parameters and move to the previous process.
Help.Text:
tslice - PROCESSLISTLEFT
Accept the current parameters and move to the previous process.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to the previous process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Menu of processes in the current workfile and their number.
Help.Text:
tslice - PROCESSLIST
Menu of processes in the current workfile and their number.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Menu that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to any chosen process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Accept the current parameters and move to the next process.
Help.Text:
tslice - PROCESSLISTRIGHT
Accept the current parameters and move to the next process.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to the next process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Save the current parameter values as Project Defaults.
Help.Text:
tslice - PROJECTDEFAULT
Save the current parameter values as Project Defaults.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that saves the current parameter values as Project Defaults for this
 process.  There will be one set of Project Defaults for a project.

Help.Tip: Save the current parameter values as User Defaults.
Help.Text:
tslice - USERDEFAULT
Save the current parameter values as User Defaults.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that saves the current parameter values as User Defaults for this
 process.  There will be one set of User Defaults for a userid.

Help.Tip: Allows the user to access the pop-up Help Window.
Help.Text:
tslice - HELP
Allows the user to access the pop-up Help Window.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 The Help Window allows access to three kinds of help:  Parameter Help, CPS
 Process Help and Application (CFE) Help.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                         C P S   P R O C E S S
 
 Name       : tslice
 Category   : Sorts
 Written    : 2000-05-01   by: Douglas Hanson
 Revised    : 2007-01-03   by: Douglas Hanson Clean up code.
 Maturity   : production
 Purpose    : put time slices to the trace flow and/or a data file.
 Portability: No known limitations.
 Parallel   : Yes.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                          GENERAL DESCRIPTION
 
 Tslice puts time slices to the trace flow and/or a data file.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                          ADVICE FOR USERS
 
  tslice passes out its traces MINP at a time.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                             REVISION HISTORY
 
     Date       Author         Description
     ----       ------         -----------
  9  2007-01-03 Douglas Hanson Clean up code.
     2003-11-07 Douglas Hanson Have tslice stack traces.
     2003-04-11 Douglas Hanson Put into alphalib
  8  2001-02-16 Douglas Hanson Allow SLICE_TOT=0
  7  2000-12-15 Douglas Hanson Correct use of no_more_traces
  6  2000-12-12 Douglas Hanson Add skip_wrapup
  5  2000-09-20 Douglas Hanson Fix slice_header ezgui error.
  4  2000-09-19 Douglas Hanson No if test for control cards.
  3  2000-09-06 Douglas Hanson fix headslice gui error
  2  2000-08-25 Douglas Hanson cpsfcr
  1  1999-12-01 Douglas Hanson Initial version.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
